trans-unit.source: How to use AzCopy with Microsoft Azure Storage
trans-unit.target: How to use AzCopy with Microsoft Azure Storage

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use the AzCopy utility to upload, download, and copy blob and file content.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use the AzCopy utility to upload, download, and copy blob and file content.

trans-unit.source: Getting Started with the AzCopy Command-Line Utility
trans-unit.target: Getting Started with the AzCopy Command-Line Utility

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: AzCopy is a command-line utility designed for high-performance uploading, downloading, and copying data to and from Microsoft Azure Blob, File, and Table storage.
trans-unit.target: AzCopy is a command-line utility designed for high-performance uploading, downloading, and copying data to and from Microsoft Azure Blob, File, and Table storage.

trans-unit.source: This guide provides an overview for using AzCopy.
trans-unit.target: This guide provides an overview for using AzCopy.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] This guide assumes that you have installed AzCopy 3.2.0 or later.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] This guide assumes that you have installed AzCopy 3.2.0 or later.

trans-unit.source: AzCopy 3.x is now in general availability.
trans-unit.target: AzCopy 3.x is now in general availability.

trans-unit.source: This guide also covers using AzCopy 4.2.0, which is a preview release of AzCopy.
trans-unit.target: This guide also covers using AzCopy 4.2.0, which is a preview release of AzCopy.

trans-unit.source: Throughout this guide, functions provided only in the preview release are designated as *preview*.
trans-unit.target: Throughout this guide, functions provided only in the preview release are designated as *preview*.

trans-unit.source: Note that for AzCopy 4.x, command-line options and functionality may change in future releases.
trans-unit.target: Note that for AzCopy 4.x, command-line options and functionality may change in future releases.

trans-unit.source: Download and install AzCopy
trans-unit.target: Download and install AzCopy

trans-unit.source: Download the [latest version of AzCopy](http://aka.ms/downloadazcopy), or the [latest preview version](http://aka.ms/downloadazcopypr).
trans-unit.target: Download the [latest version of AzCopy](http://aka.ms/downloadazcopy), or the [latest preview version](http://aka.ms/downloadazcopypr).

trans-unit.source: Run the installation.
trans-unit.target: Run the installation.

trans-unit.source: By default, the AzCopy installation creates a folder named `AzCopy` under `%ProgramFiles(x86)%\Microsoft SDKs\Azure\` (on a machine running 64-bit Windows) or `%ProgramFiles%\Microsoft SDKs\Azure\` (on a machine running 32-bit Windows).
trans-unit.target: By default, the AzCopy installation creates a folder named `AzCopy` under `%ProgramFiles(x86)%\Microsoft SDKs\Azure\` (on a machine running 64-bit Windows) or `%ProgramFiles%\Microsoft SDKs\Azure\` (on a machine running 32-bit Windows).

trans-unit.source: However, you can change the installation path from the setup wizard.
trans-unit.target: However, you can change the installation path from the setup wizard.

trans-unit.source: If desired, you can add the AzCopy installation location to your system path.
trans-unit.target: If desired, you can add the AzCopy installation location to your system path.

trans-unit.source: Understand the AzCopy command-line syntax
trans-unit.target: Understand the AzCopy command-line syntax

trans-unit.source: Next, open a command window, and navigate to the AzCopy installation directory on your computer, where the `AzCopy.exe` executable is located.
trans-unit.target: Next, open a command window, and navigate to the AzCopy installation directory on your computer, where the `AzCopy.exe` executable is located.

trans-unit.source: The basic syntax for AzCopy commands is:
trans-unit.target: The basic syntax for AzCopy commands is:

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] Beginning with AzCopy version 3.0.0, the AzCopy command-line syntax requires that every parameter be specified to include the parameter name, *e.g.*, `/ParameterName:ParameterValue`.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] Beginning with AzCopy version 3.0.0, the AzCopy command-line syntax requires that every parameter be specified to include the parameter name, *e.g.*, `/ParameterName:ParameterValue`.

trans-unit.source: Write your first AzCopy command
trans-unit.target: Write your first AzCopy command

trans-unit.source: Upload a file from the file system to Blob storage:
trans-unit.target: Upload a file from the file system to Blob storage:

trans-unit.source: Note that when copying single file, please specify option /Pattern with the file name.
trans-unit.target: Note that when copying single file, please specify option /Pattern with the file name.

trans-unit.source: You can find more samples in the later section of this article.
trans-unit.target: You can find more samples in the later section of this article.

trans-unit.source: Introduction to the parameters
trans-unit.target: Introduction to the parameters

trans-unit.source: Parameters for AzCopy are described in the table below.
trans-unit.target: Parameters for AzCopy are described in the table below.

trans-unit.source: You can also type one of the following commands from the command line for help in using AzCopy:
trans-unit.target: You can also type one of the following commands from the command line for help in using AzCopy:

trans-unit.source: For detailed command-line help for AzCopy: `AzCopy /?`
trans-unit.target: For detailed command-line help for AzCopy: `AzCopy /?`

trans-unit.source: For detailed help with any AzCopy parameter: `AzCopy /?:SourceKey`
trans-unit.target: For detailed help with any AzCopy parameter: `AzCopy /?:SourceKey`

trans-unit.source: For command-line examples: `AzCopy /?:Samples`
trans-unit.target: For command-line examples: `AzCopy /?:Samples`

trans-unit.source: Option Name
trans-unit.target: Option Name

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Applicable to Blob Storage (Y/N)
trans-unit.target: Applicable to Blob Storage (Y/N)

trans-unit.source: Applicable to File Storage (Y/N) (preview release only)
trans-unit.target: Applicable to File Storage (Y/N) (preview release only)

trans-unit.source: Applicable to Table Storage (Y/N) (preview release only)
trans-unit.target: Applicable to Table Storage (Y/N) (preview release only)

trans-unit.source: /Source:<source>
trans-unit.target: /Source:<source>

trans-unit.source: Specifies the source data from which to copy.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the source data from which to copy.

trans-unit.source: The source can be a file system directory, a blob container, a blob virtual directory, a storage file share, a storage file directory, or an Azure table.
trans-unit.target: The source can be a file system directory, a blob container, a blob virtual directory, a storage file share, a storage file directory, or an Azure table.

trans-unit.target: Y

trans-unit.source: /Dest:<destination>
trans-unit.target: /Dest:<destination>

trans-unit.source: Specifies the destination to copy to.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the destination to copy to.

trans-unit.source: The destination can be a file system directory, a blob container, a blob virtual directory, a storage file share, a storage file directory, or an Azure table.
trans-unit.target: The destination can be a file system directory, a blob container, a blob virtual directory, a storage file share, a storage file directory, or an Azure table.

trans-unit.source: /S
trans-unit.target: /S

trans-unit.source: Specifies recursive mode for copy operations.
trans-unit.target: Specifies recursive mode for copy operations.

trans-unit.source: In recursive mode, AzCopy will copy all blobs or files that match the specified file pattern, including those in subfolders.
trans-unit.target: In recursive mode, AzCopy will copy all blobs or files that match the specified file pattern, including those in subfolders.

trans-unit.source: Y
trans-unit.target: Y

trans-unit.source: Y
trans-unit.target: Y

trans-unit.source: (preview only)
trans-unit.target: (preview only)

trans-unit.source: N
trans-unit.target: N

trans-unit.source: /BlobType:<block | page | append>
trans-unit.target: /BlobType:<block | page | append>

trans-unit.source: Specifies whether the destination blob is a block blob, a page blob or an append blob.
trans-unit.target: Specifies whether the destination blob is a block blob, a page blob or an append blob.

trans-unit.source: This option is applicable only when uploading blob; otherwise, an error is generated.
trans-unit.target: This option is applicable only when uploading blob; otherwise, an error is generated.

trans-unit.source: If the destination is a blob and this option is not specified, then by default AzCopy will create a block blob.
trans-unit.target: If the destination is a blob and this option is not specified, then by default AzCopy will create a block blob.

trans-unit.source: Y
trans-unit.target: Y

trans-unit.source: N
trans-unit.target: N

trans-unit.source: N
trans-unit.target: N

trans-unit.source: /CheckMD5
trans-unit.target: /CheckMD5

trans-unit.source: Calculates an MD5 hash for downloaded data and verifies that the MD5 hash stored in the blob or file's Content-MD5 property matches the calculated hash.
trans-unit.target: Calculates an MD5 hash for downloaded data and verifies that the MD5 hash stored in the blob or file's Content-MD5 property matches the calculated hash.

trans-unit.source: The MD5 check is turned off by default, so you must specify this option to perform the MD5 check when downloading data.
trans-unit.target: The MD5 check is turned off by default, so you must specify this option to perform the MD5 check when downloading data.

trans-unit.source: Y
trans-unit.target: Y

trans-unit.source: Y
trans-unit.target: Y

trans-unit.target: (preview only)

trans-unit.source: N
trans-unit.target: N

trans-unit.target: /Snapshot

trans-unit.source: Indicates whether to transfer snapshots.
trans-unit.target: Indicates whether to transfer snapshots.

trans-unit.source: This option is only valid when the source is a blob.
trans-unit.target: This option is only valid when the source is a blob.

trans-unit.source: /V:[verbose log-file]
trans-unit.target: /V:[verbose log-file]

trans-unit.source: Outputs verbose status messages into a log file.
trans-unit.target: Outputs verbose status messages into a log file.

trans-unit.source: By default, the verbose log file is named
trans-unit.target: By default, the verbose log file is named

trans-unit.source: in
trans-unit.target: in

trans-unit.source: If you specify an existing file location for this option, the verbose log will be appended to that file.
trans-unit.target: If you specify an existing file location for this option, the verbose log will be appended to that file.

trans-unit.source: /SetContentType:<content-type>
trans-unit.target: /SetContentType:<content-type>

trans-unit.source: Specifies the MIME content type for destination blobs or files.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the MIME content type for destination blobs or files.

trans-unit.source: by default.
trans-unit.target: by default.

trans-unit.source: You can set the content type for all blobs or files by explicitly specifying a value for this option.
trans-unit.target: You can set the content type for all blobs or files by explicitly specifying a value for this option.

trans-unit.source: If you specify this option without a value, then AzCopy will set each blob or file's content type according to its file extension.
trans-unit.target: If you specify this option without a value, then AzCopy will set each blob or file's content type according to its file extension.

trans-unit.source: Y
trans-unit.target: Y

trans-unit.source: (preview only)
trans-unit.target: (preview only)

trans-unit.source: Limit concurrent writes while copying data
trans-unit.target: Limit concurrent writes while copying data

trans-unit.source: When you copy blobs or files with AzCopy, keep in mind that another application may be modifying the data while you are copying it.
trans-unit.target: When you copy blobs or files with AzCopy, keep in mind that another application may be modifying the data while you are copying it.

trans-unit.source: If possible, ensure that the data you are copying is not being modified during the copy operation.
trans-unit.target: If possible, ensure that the data you are copying is not being modified during the copy operation.

trans-unit.source: For example, when copying a VHD associated with an Azure virtual machine, make sure that no other applications are currently writing to the VHD.
trans-unit.target: For example, when copying a VHD associated with an Azure virtual machine, make sure that no other applications are currently writing to the VHD.

trans-unit.source: Alternately, you can create a snapshot of the VHD first and then copy the snapshot.
trans-unit.target: Alternately, you can create a snapshot of the VHD first and then copy the snapshot.

trans-unit.source: If you cannot prevent other applications from writing to blobs or files while they are being copied, then keep in mind that by the time the job finishes, the copied resources may no longer have full parity with the source resources.
trans-unit.target: If you cannot prevent other applications from writing to blobs or files while they are being copied, then keep in mind that by the time the job finishes, the copied resources may no longer have full parity with the source resources.

trans-unit.target: Copy Azure blobs with AzCopy

trans-unit.source: The examples below demonstrate a variety of scenarios for copying blobs with AzCopy.
trans-unit.target: The examples below demonstrate a variety of scenarios for copying blobs with AzCopy.

trans-unit.target: Copy a single blob

trans-unit.target: Upload a file from the file system to Blob storage:

trans-unit.source: Copy a blob via server-side copy
trans-unit.target: Copy a blob via server-side copy

trans-unit.source: When you copy a blob within a storage account or across storage accounts, a server-side copy operation is performed.
trans-unit.target: When you copy a blob within a storage account or across storage accounts, a server-side copy operation is performed.

trans-unit.source: For more information about server-side copy operations, see [Introducing Asynchronous Cross-Account Copy Blob](http://blogs.msdn.com/b/windowsazurestorage/archive/2012/06/12/introducing-asynchronous-cross-account-copy-blob.aspx).
trans-unit.target: For more information about server-side copy operations, see [Introducing Asynchronous Cross-Account Copy Blob](http://blogs.msdn.com/b/windowsazurestorage/archive/2012/06/12/introducing-asynchronous-cross-account-copy-blob.aspx).

trans-unit.target: Copy a blob from the secondary region

trans-unit.target: If your storage account has read-access geo-redundant storage enabled, then you can copy data from the secondary region.

trans-unit.target: Upload a file to a new blob container or virtual directory

trans-unit.target: Upload a file to a new blob container

trans-unit.source: Note that if the specified destination container does not exist, AzCopy will create it and upload the file into it.
trans-unit.target: Note that if the specified destination container does not exist, AzCopy will create it and upload the file into it.

trans-unit.target: Upload a file to a new blob virtual directory

trans-unit.target: Note that if the specified virtual directory does not exist, AzCopy will upload the file to include the virtual directory in its name (*e.g.*, `vd/abc.txt` in the example above).

trans-unit.target: Download a blob to a new folder

trans-unit.source: If the folder `C:\myfolder` does not yet exist, AzCopy will create it in the file system and download `abc.txt ` into the new folder.
trans-unit.target: If the folder `C:\myfolder` does not yet exist, AzCopy will create it in the file system and download `abc.txt ` into the new folder.

trans-unit.target: Upload files and subfolders in a directory to a container, recursively

trans-unit.source: Specifying option `/S` copies the contents of the specified directory to Blob storage recursively, meaning that all subfolders and their files will be copied as well.
trans-unit.target: Specifying option `/S` copies the contents of the specified directory to Blob storage recursively, meaning that all subfolders and their files will be copied as well.

trans-unit.target: Upload files from a directory to a container, non-recursively

trans-unit.target: If you do not specify option `/S` on the command line, AzCopy will not copy recursively.

trans-unit.source: Only the files in the specified directory are copied; any subfolders and their files are NOT copied.
trans-unit.target: Only the files in the specified directory are copied; any subfolders and their files are NOT copied.

trans-unit.source: Use a response file to specify command-line parameters
trans-unit.target: Use a response file to specify command-line parameters

trans-unit.source: You can include any AzCopy command-line parameters in a response file.
trans-unit.target: You can include any AzCopy command-line parameters in a response file.

trans-unit.source: AzCopy processes the parameters in the file as if they had been specified on the command line, performing a direct substitution with the contents of the file.
trans-unit.target: AzCopy processes the parameters in the file as if they had been specified on the command line, performing a direct substitution with the contents of the file.

trans-unit.source: Specify one or more single-line response files
trans-unit.target: Specify one or more single-line response files

trans-unit.source: Assume a response file named `source.txt` that specifies a source container:
trans-unit.target: Assume a response file named `source.txt` that specifies a source container:

trans-unit.source: And a response file named `dest.txt` that specifies a destination folder in the file system:
trans-unit.target: And a response file named `dest.txt` that specifies a destination folder in the file system:

trans-unit.source: And a response file named `options.txt` that specifies options for AzCopy:
trans-unit.target: And a response file named `options.txt` that specifies options for AzCopy:

trans-unit.source: To call AzCopy with these response files, all of which reside in a directory `C:\responsefiles`, use this command:
trans-unit.target: To call AzCopy with these response files, all of which reside in a directory `C:\responsefiles`, use this command:

trans-unit.source: AzCopy processes this command just as it would if you included all of the individual parameters on the command line:
trans-unit.target: AzCopy processes this command just as it would if you included all of the individual parameters on the command line:

trans-unit.source: Specify a multi-line response file
trans-unit.target: Specify a multi-line response file

trans-unit.source: Assume a response file named `copyoperation.txt`, that contains the following lines.
trans-unit.target: Assume a response file named `copyoperation.txt`, that contains the following lines.

trans-unit.source: Each AzCopy parameter is specified on its own line:
trans-unit.target: Each AzCopy parameter is specified on its own line:

trans-unit.source: To call AzCopy with this response files, use this command:
trans-unit.target: To call AzCopy with this response files, use this command:

trans-unit.source: AzCopy processes this command just as it would if you included all of the individual parameters on the command line:
trans-unit.target: AzCopy processes this command just as it would if you included all of the individual parameters on the command line:

trans-unit.source: Note that each AzCopy parameter must be specified all on one line.
trans-unit.target: Note that each AzCopy parameter must be specified all on one line.

trans-unit.source: For example, AzCopy will fail if you split the parameter across two lines, as shown here for the `/sourcekey` parameter:
trans-unit.target: For example, AzCopy will fail if you split the parameter across two lines, as shown here for the `/sourcekey` parameter:

trans-unit.source: Specify a shared access signature (SAS)
trans-unit.target: Specify a shared access signature (SAS)

trans-unit.source: Specify a SAS for the source container using the /sourceSAS option
trans-unit.target: Specify a SAS for the source container using the /sourceSAS option

trans-unit.source: Specify a SAS for the source container on the source container URI
trans-unit.target: Specify a SAS for the source container on the source container URI

trans-unit.source: Specify a SAS for the destination container using the /destSAS option
trans-unit.target: Specify a SAS for the destination container using the /destSAS option

trans-unit.source: Specify a SAS for the source and destination containers
trans-unit.target: Specify a SAS for the source and destination containers

trans-unit.source: Specify a journal file folder
trans-unit.target: Specify a journal file folder

trans-unit.source: Each time you issue a command to AzCopy, it checks whether a journal file exists in the default folder, or whether it exists in a folder that you specified via this option.
trans-unit.target: Each time you issue a command to AzCopy, it checks whether a journal file exists in the default folder, or whether it exists in a folder that you specified via this option.

trans-unit.source: If the journal file does not exist in either place, AzCopy treats the operation as new and generates a new journal file.
trans-unit.target: If the journal file does not exist in either place, AzCopy treats the operation as new and generates a new journal file.

trans-unit.source: If the journal file does exist, AzCopy will check whether the command line that you input matches the command line in the journal file.
trans-unit.target: If the journal file does exist, AzCopy will check whether the command line that you input matches the command line in the journal file.

trans-unit.source: If the two command lines match, AzCopy resumes the incomplete operation.
trans-unit.target: If the two command lines match, AzCopy resumes the incomplete operation.

trans-unit.source: If they do not match, you will be prompted to either overwrite the journal file to start a new operation, or to cancel the current operation.
trans-unit.target: If they do not match, you will be prompted to either overwrite the journal file to start a new operation, or to cancel the current operation.

trans-unit.source: Use the default location for the journal file
trans-unit.target: Use the default location for the journal file

trans-unit.source: If you omit option `/Z`, or specify option `/Z` without the folder path, as shown above, AzCopy creates the journal file in the default location, which is `%SystemDrive%\Users\%username%\AppData\Local\Microsoft\Azure\AzCopy`.
trans-unit.target: If you omit option `/Z`, or specify option `/Z` without the folder path, as shown above, AzCopy creates the journal file in the default location, which is `%SystemDrive%\Users\%username%\AppData\Local\Microsoft\Azure\AzCopy`.

trans-unit.source: If the journal file already exists, then AzCopy resumes the operation based on the journal file.
trans-unit.target: If the journal file already exists, then AzCopy resumes the operation based on the journal file.

trans-unit.source: Specify a custom location for the journal file
trans-unit.target: Specify a custom location for the journal file

trans-unit.source: This example creates the journal file if it does not already exist.
trans-unit.target: This example creates the journal file if it does not already exist.

trans-unit.source: If it does exist, then AzCopy resumes the operation based on the journal file.
trans-unit.target: If it does exist, then AzCopy resumes the operation based on the journal file.

trans-unit.source: Resume an AzCopy operation
trans-unit.target: Resume an AzCopy operation

trans-unit.source: This example resumes the last operation, which may have failed to complete.
trans-unit.target: This example resumes the last operation, which may have failed to complete.

trans-unit.source: Generate a log file
trans-unit.target: Generate a log file

trans-unit.source: Write to the verbose log file in the default location
trans-unit.target: Write to the verbose log file in the default location

trans-unit.source: If you specify option `/V` without providing a file path to the verbose log, then AzCopy creates the log file in the default location, which is `%SystemDrive%\Users\%username%\AppData\Local\Microsoft\Azure\AzCopy`.
trans-unit.target: If you specify option `/V` without providing a file path to the verbose log, then AzCopy creates the log file in the default location, which is `%SystemDrive%\Users\%username%\AppData\Local\Microsoft\Azure\AzCopy`.

trans-unit.source: Write to the verbose log file in a custom location
trans-unit.target: Write to the verbose log file in a custom location

trans-unit.source: Note that if you specify a relative path following option `/V`, such as `/V:test/azcopy1.log`, then the verbose log is created in the current working directory within a subfolder named `test`.
trans-unit.target: Note that if you specify a relative path following option `/V`, such as `/V:test/azcopy1.log`, then the verbose log is created in the current working directory within a subfolder named `test`.

trans-unit.source: Set the last-modified time of downloaded files to be same as the source blobs
trans-unit.target: Set the last-modified time of downloaded files to be same as the source blobs

trans-unit.source: Exclude blobs from the copy operation based on their last-modified time
trans-unit.target: Exclude blobs from the copy operation based on their last-modified time

trans-unit.source: Specify the `/MT` option to compare the last-modified time of the source blob and the destination file.
trans-unit.target: Specify the `/MT` option to compare the last-modified time of the source blob and the destination file.

trans-unit.source: Exclude blobs that are newer than the destination file
trans-unit.target: Exclude blobs that are newer than the destination file

trans-unit.source: Exclude blobs that are older than the destination file
trans-unit.target: Exclude blobs that are older than the destination file

trans-unit.source: Specify the number of concurrent operations to start
trans-unit.target: Specify the number of concurrent operations to start

trans-unit.source: Option `/NC` specifies the number of concurrent copy operations.
trans-unit.target: Option `/NC` specifies the number of concurrent copy operations.

trans-unit.source: By default, AzCopy will begin concurrent operations at eight times the number of core processors you have.
trans-unit.target: By default, AzCopy will begin concurrent operations at eight times the number of core processors you have.

trans-unit.source: If you are running AzCopy across a low-bandwidth network, you can specify a lower number for this option to avoid failure caused by resource competition.
trans-unit.target: If you are running AzCopy across a low-bandwidth network, you can specify a lower number for this option to avoid failure caused by resource competition.

trans-unit.source: Run AzCopy against blob resources in the storage emulator
trans-unit.target: Run AzCopy against blob resources in the storage emulator

trans-unit.source: Synchronously copy blobs between two Azure Storage endpoints
trans-unit.target: Synchronously copy blobs between two Azure Storage endpoints

trans-unit.source: AzCopy by default copies data between two storage endpoints asynchronously.
trans-unit.target: AzCopy by default copies data between two storage endpoints asynchronously.

trans-unit.source: Therefore, the copy operation will run in the background using spare bandwidth capacity that has no SLA in terms of how fast a blob will be copied, and AzCopy will periodically check the copy status until the copying is completed or failed.
trans-unit.target: Therefore, the copy operation will run in the background using spare bandwidth capacity that has no SLA in terms of how fast a blob will be copied, and AzCopy will periodically check the copy status until the copying is completed or failed.

trans-unit.source: The `/SyncCopy` option ensures that the copy operation will get consistent speed.
trans-unit.target: The `/SyncCopy` option ensures that the copy operation will get consistent speed.

trans-unit.source: AzCopy performs the synchronous copy by downloading the blobs to copy from the specified source to local memory, and then uploading them to the Blob storage destination.
trans-unit.target: AzCopy performs the synchronous copy by downloading the blobs to copy from the specified source to local memory, and then uploading them to the Blob storage destination.

trans-unit.source: Note that `/SyncCopy` might generate additional egress cost comparing to asynchronous copy, the recommended approach is to use this option in the Azure VM which is in the same region as your source storage account to avoid egress cost.
trans-unit.target: Note that `/SyncCopy` might generate additional egress cost comparing to asynchronous copy, the recommended approach is to use this option in the Azure VM which is in the same region as your source storage account to avoid egress cost.

trans-unit.source: Specify the MIME content type of a destination blob
trans-unit.target: Specify the MIME content type of a destination blob

trans-unit.source: By default, AzCopy sets the content type of a destination blob to `application/octet-stream`.
trans-unit.target: By default, AzCopy sets the content type of a destination blob to `application/octet-stream`.

trans-unit.source: Beginning with version 3.1.0, you can explicitly specify the content type via the option `/SetContentType:[content-type]`.
trans-unit.target: Beginning with version 3.1.0, you can explicitly specify the content type via the option `/SetContentType:[content-type]`.

trans-unit.source: This syntax sets the content type for all blobs in a copy operation.
trans-unit.target: This syntax sets the content type for all blobs in a copy operation.

trans-unit.source: If you specify `/SetContentType` without a value, then AzCopy will set each blob or file's content type according to its file extension.
trans-unit.target: If you specify `/SetContentType` without a value, then AzCopy will set each blob or file's content type according to its file extension.

trans-unit.source: Copy files in Azure File storage with AzCopy (preview version only)
trans-unit.target: Copy files in Azure File storage with AzCopy (preview version only)

trans-unit.source: The examples below demonstrate a variety of scenarios for copying Azure files with AzCopy.
trans-unit.target: The examples below demonstrate a variety of scenarios for copying Azure files with AzCopy.

trans-unit.source: Download a file from an Azure file share to the file system
trans-unit.target: Download a file from an Azure file share to the file system

trans-unit.source: Note that if the specified source is an Azure file share, then you must either specify the exact file name, (*e.g.* `abc.txt`) to copy a single file, or specify option `/S` to copy all files in the share recursively.
trans-unit.target: Note that if the specified source is an Azure file share, then you must either specify the exact file name, (*e.g.* `abc.txt`) to copy a single file, or specify option `/S` to copy all files in the share recursively.

trans-unit.source: Attempting to specify both a file pattern and option `/S` together will result in an error.
trans-unit.target: Attempting to specify both a file pattern and option `/S` together will result in an error.

trans-unit.source: Download files and folders in an Azure file share to the file system, recursively, specify the share access signature
trans-unit.target: Download files and folders in an Azure file share to the file system, recursively, specify the share access signature

trans-unit.source: Note that any empty folders will not be copied.
trans-unit.target: Note that any empty folders will not be copied.

trans-unit.source: Upload files and folders from the file system to an Azure file share, recursively
trans-unit.target: Upload files and folders from the file system to an Azure file share, recursively

trans-unit.source: Note that any empty folders will not be copied.
trans-unit.target: Note that any empty folders will not be copied.

trans-unit.source: Upload files matching the specified file pattern to an Azure file share, recursively
trans-unit.target: Upload files matching the specified file pattern to an Azure file share, recursively

trans-unit.source: Asynchronously copy files in Azure File Storage
trans-unit.target: Asynchronously copy files in Azure File Storage

trans-unit.source: Azure File Storage supports server side asynchronous copying.
trans-unit.target: Azure File Storage supports server side asynchronous copying.

trans-unit.source: Asynchronous copying from File Storage to File Storage:
trans-unit.target: Asynchronous copying from File Storage to File Storage:

trans-unit.source: Asynchronous copying from File Storage to Block Blob:
trans-unit.target: Asynchronous copying from File Storage to Block Blob:

trans-unit.source: Asynchronous copying from Block/Page Blob Storage to File Storage:
trans-unit.target: Asynchronous copying from Block/Page Blob Storage to File Storage:

trans-unit.source: Note that asynchronous copying from File Storage to Page Blob is not supported.
trans-unit.target: Note that asynchronous copying from File Storage to Page Blob is not supported.

trans-unit.source: Synchronously copy files in Azure File Storage
trans-unit.target: Synchronously copy files in Azure File Storage

trans-unit.source: Besides the asynchronous copying, user can also specify option `/SyncCopy` to copy data from File Storage to File Storage, from File Storage to Blob Storage and from Blob Storage to File Storage synchronously, AzCopy does this by downloading the source data to local memory and upload it again to destination.
trans-unit.target: Besides the asynchronous copying, user can also specify option `/SyncCopy` to copy data from File Storage to File Storage, from File Storage to Blob Storage and from Blob Storage to File Storage synchronously, AzCopy does this by downloading the source data to local memory and upload it again to destination.

trans-unit.source: When copying from File Storage to Blob Storage, the default blob type is block blob, user can specify option `/BlobType:page` to change the destination blob type.
trans-unit.target: When copying from File Storage to Blob Storage, the default blob type is block blob, user can specify option `/BlobType:page` to change the destination blob type.

trans-unit.source: Note that `/SyncCopy` might generate additional egress cost comparing to asynchronous copy, the recommended approach is to use this option in the Azure VM which is in the same region as your source storage account to avoid egress cost.
trans-unit.target: Note that `/SyncCopy` might generate additional egress cost comparing to asynchronous copy, the recommended approach is to use this option in the Azure VM which is in the same region as your source storage account to avoid egress cost.

trans-unit.source: Copy Entities in an Azure Table with AzCopy (preview version only)
trans-unit.target: Copy Entities in an Azure Table with AzCopy (preview version only)

trans-unit.source: The examples below demonstrate a variety of scenarios for copying Azure Table Entities with AzCopy.
trans-unit.target: The examples below demonstrate a variety of scenarios for copying Azure Table Entities with AzCopy.

trans-unit.source: Export entities to the local file system
trans-unit.target: Export entities to the local file system

trans-unit.source: AzCopy writes a manifest file to the specified destination folder or blob container.
trans-unit.target: AzCopy writes a manifest file to the specified destination folder or blob container.

trans-unit.source: The manifest file is used by the import process to locate the necessary data files and perform data validation during the import process.
trans-unit.target: The manifest file is used by the import process to locate the necessary data files and perform data validation during the import process.

trans-unit.source: The manifest file uses the following naming convention by default:
trans-unit.target: The manifest file uses the following naming convention by default:

trans-unit.source: User can also specify the option `/Manifest:<manifest file name>` to set the manifest file name.
trans-unit.target: User can also specify the option `/Manifest:<manifest file name>` to set the manifest file name.

trans-unit.source: Export entites to JSON and CSV data file format
trans-unit.target: Export entites to JSON and CSV data file format

trans-unit.source: AzCopy by default exports Table entites to JSON files, user can specify option `/PayloadFormat:JSON|CSV` to decide the exported data file type.
trans-unit.target: AzCopy by default exports Table entites to JSON files, user can specify option `/PayloadFormat:JSON|CSV` to decide the exported data file type.

trans-unit.source: When specifying the CSV payload format, besides the data files with `.csv` extension that will be found in the place specified by the parameter `/Dest`, AzCopy will generate scheme file with file extension `.schema.csv` for each data file.
trans-unit.target: When specifying the CSV payload format, besides the data files with `.csv` extension that will be found in the place specified by the parameter `/Dest`, AzCopy will generate scheme file with file extension `.schema.csv` for each data file.

trans-unit.source: Note that AzCopy does not include the support for importing CSV data file, you can use JSON format to export and import table data.
trans-unit.target: Note that AzCopy does not include the support for importing CSV data file, you can use JSON format to export and import table data.

trans-unit.source: Export entities to an Azure blob
trans-unit.target: Export entities to an Azure blob

trans-unit.source: AzCopy will generate a JSON data file into the local folder or blob container with following naming convention:
trans-unit.target: AzCopy will generate a JSON data file into the local folder or blob container with following naming convention:

trans-unit.source: The generated JSON data file follows the payload format for minimal metadata.
trans-unit.target: The generated JSON data file follows the payload format for minimal metadata.

trans-unit.source: For details on this payload format, see [Payload Format for Table Service Operations](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn535600.aspx).
trans-unit.target: For details on this payload format, see [Payload Format for Table Service Operations](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn535600.aspx).

trans-unit.source: Note that when exporting Storage Table Entities to Storage Blob, AzCopy will export the Table entities to local temporary data files firstly and then upload them to Blob, these temporary data files are put into the journal file folder with the default path %LocalAppData%\Microsoft\Azure\AzCopy, you can specify option /Z:[journal-file-folder] to change the journal file folder location and thus change the temporary data files location.
trans-unit.target: Note that when exporting Storage Table Entities to Storage Blob, AzCopy will export the Table entities to local temporary data files firstly and then upload them to Blob, these temporary data files are put into the journal file folder with the default path %LocalAppData%\Microsoft\Azure\AzCopy, you can specify option /Z:[journal-file-folder] to change the journal file folder location and thus change the temporary data files location.

trans-unit.source: The temporary data files size is decided by your table entities size and the size you specified with the option /SplitSize, although the temporary data file in local disk will be deleted instantly once it has been uploaded to the Blob, please make sure you have enough local disk space to store these temporary data files before they are deleted,
trans-unit.target: The temporary data files size is decided by your table entities size and the size you specified with the option /SplitSize, although the temporary data file in local disk will be deleted instantly once it has been uploaded to the Blob, please make sure you have enough local disk space to store these temporary data files before they are deleted,

trans-unit.source: Split the export files
trans-unit.target: Split the export files

trans-unit.source: AzCopy uses a *volume index* in the split data file names to distinguish multiple files.
trans-unit.target: AzCopy uses a *volume index* in the split data file names to distinguish multiple files.

trans-unit.source: The volume index consists of two parts, a *partition key range index* and a *split file index*.
trans-unit.target: The volume index consists of two parts, a *partition key range index* and a *split file index*.

trans-unit.source: Both indexes are zero-based.
trans-unit.target: Both indexes are zero-based.

trans-unit.source: The partition key range index will be 0 if user does not specify option `/PKRS` (introduced in next section).
trans-unit.target: The partition key range index will be 0 if user does not specify option `/PKRS` (introduced in next section).

trans-unit.source: For instance, suppose AzCopy generates two data files after the user specifies option `/SplitSize`.
trans-unit.target: For instance, suppose AzCopy generates two data files after the user specifies option `/SplitSize`.

trans-unit.source: The resulting data file names might be:
trans-unit.target: The resulting data file names might be:

trans-unit.source: Note that the minimum possible value for option `/SplitSize` is 32MB.
trans-unit.target: Note that the minimum possible value for option `/SplitSize` is 32MB.

trans-unit.source: If the specified destination is Blob storage, AzCopy will split the data file once its sizes reaches the blob size limitation (200GB), regardless of whether option `/SplitSize` has been specified by the user.
trans-unit.target: If the specified destination is Blob storage, AzCopy will split the data file once its sizes reaches the blob size limitation (200GB), regardless of whether option `/SplitSize` has been specified by the user.

trans-unit.source: Export entities concurrently
trans-unit.target: Export entities concurrently

trans-unit.source: AzCopy will start concurrent operations to export entities when the user specifies option `/PKRS`.
trans-unit.target: AzCopy will start concurrent operations to export entities when the user specifies option `/PKRS`.

trans-unit.source: Each operation exports one partition key range.
trans-unit.target: Each operation exports one partition key range.

trans-unit.source: Note that the number of concurrent operations is also controlled by option `/NC`.
trans-unit.target: Note that the number of concurrent operations is also controlled by option `/NC`.

trans-unit.source: AzCopy uses the number of core processors as the default value of `/NC` when copying table entities, even if `/NC` was not specified.
trans-unit.target: AzCopy uses the number of core processors as the default value of `/NC` when copying table entities, even if `/NC` was not specified.

trans-unit.source: When the user specifies option `/PKRS`, AzCopy uses the smaller of the two values - partition key ranges versus implicitly or explicitly specified concurrent operations - to determine the number of concurrent operations to start.
trans-unit.target: When the user specifies option `/PKRS`, AzCopy uses the smaller of the two values - partition key ranges versus implicitly or explicitly specified concurrent operations - to determine the number of concurrent operations to start.

trans-unit.source: For more details, type `AzCopy /?:NC` at the command line.
trans-unit.target: For more details, type `AzCopy /?:NC` at the command line.

trans-unit.source: Import entities concurrently
trans-unit.target: Import entities concurrently

trans-unit.source: The option `/EntityOperation` indicates how to insert entities into the table.
trans-unit.target: The option `/EntityOperation` indicates how to insert entities into the table.

trans-unit.source: Possible values are:
trans-unit.target: Possible values are:

trans-unit.source: `InsertOrSkip`: Skips an existing entity or inserts a new entity if it does not exist in the table.
trans-unit.target: `InsertOrSkip`: Skips an existing entity or inserts a new entity if it does not exist in the table.

trans-unit.source: `InsertOrMerge`: Merges an existing entity or inserts a new entity if it does not exist in the table.
trans-unit.target: `InsertOrMerge`: Merges an existing entity or inserts a new entity if it does not exist in the table.

trans-unit.source: `InsertOrReplace`: Replaces an existing entity or inserts a new entity if it does not exist in the table.
trans-unit.target: `InsertOrReplace`: Replaces an existing entity or inserts a new entity if it does not exist in the table.

trans-unit.source: Note that you cannot specify option `/PKRS` in the import scenario.
trans-unit.target: Note that you cannot specify option `/PKRS` in the import scenario.

trans-unit.source: Unlike the export scenario, in which you must specify option `/PKRS` to start concurrent operations, AzCopy will by default start concurrent operations when you import entities.
trans-unit.target: Unlike the export scenario, in which you must specify option `/PKRS` to start concurrent operations, AzCopy will by default start concurrent operations when you import entities.

trans-unit.source: The default number of concurrent operations started is equal to the number of core processors; however, you can specify a different number of concurrent with option `/NC`.
trans-unit.target: The default number of concurrent operations started is equal to the number of core processors; however, you can specify a different number of concurrent with option `/NC`.

trans-unit.source: For more details, type `AzCopy /?:NC` at the command line.
trans-unit.target: For more details, type `AzCopy /?:NC` at the command line.

trans-unit.source: Known Issues and Best Practices
trans-unit.target: Known Issues and Best Practices

trans-unit.source: Run one AzCopy instance on one machine.
trans-unit.target: Run one AzCopy instance on one machine.

trans-unit.source: AzCopy is designed to maximize the utilization of your machine resource to accelerate the data transfer, we recommend you run only one AzCopy instance on one machine, and specify the option `/NC` if you need more concurrent operations.
trans-unit.target: AzCopy is designed to maximize the utilization of your machine resource to accelerate the data transfer, we recommend you run only one AzCopy instance on one machine, and specify the option `/NC` if you need more concurrent operations.

trans-unit.source: For more details, type `AzCopy /?:NC` at the command line.
trans-unit.target: For more details, type `AzCopy /?:NC` at the command line.

trans-unit.source: Enable FIPS compliant MD5 algorithms for AzCopy when you "Use FIPS compliant algorithms for encryption, hashing and signing".
trans-unit.target: Enable FIPS compliant MD5 algorithms for AzCopy when you "Use FIPS compliant algorithms for encryption, hashing and signing".

trans-unit.source: AzCopy by default uses .NET MD5 implementation to calculate the MD5 when copying objects, but there are some security requirements that need AzCopy to enable FIPS compliant MD5 setting.
trans-unit.target: AzCopy by default uses .NET MD5 implementation to calculate the MD5 when copying objects, but there are some security requirements that need AzCopy to enable FIPS compliant MD5 setting.

trans-unit.source: You can create an app.config file `AzCopy.exe.config` with property `AzureStorageUseV1MD5` and put it aside with AzCopy.exe.
trans-unit.target: You can create an app.config file `AzCopy.exe.config` with property `AzureStorageUseV1MD5` and put it aside with AzCopy.exe.

trans-unit.source: For property AzureStorageUseV1MD5
trans-unit.target: For property AzureStorageUseV1MD5

trans-unit.source: True - The default value, AzCopy will use .NET MD5 implementation.
trans-unit.target: True - The default value, AzCopy will use .NET MD5 implementation.

trans-unit.source: False AzCopy will use FIPS compliant MD5 algorithm.
trans-unit.target: False AzCopy will use FIPS compliant MD5 algorithm.

trans-unit.source: Note that FIPS compliant algorithms is disabled by default on your Windows machine, you can type secpol.msc in your Run window and check this switch at Security Setting->Local Policy->Security Options->System cryptography: Use FIPS compliant algorithms for encryption, hashing and signing.
trans-unit.target: Note that FIPS compliant algorithms is disabled by default on your Windows machine, you can type secpol.msc in your Run window and check this switch at Security Setting->Local Policy->Security Options->System cryptography: Use FIPS compliant algorithms for encryption, hashing and signing.

trans-unit.source: AzCopy versions
trans-unit.target: AzCopy versions

trans-unit.source: Version
trans-unit.target: Version

trans-unit.source: What's New
trans-unit.target: What's New

trans-unit.source: Current preview version.
trans-unit.target: Current preview version.

trans-unit.source: Includes all the functionality from V3.2.0.
trans-unit.target: Includes all the functionality from V3.2.0.

trans-unit.source: Also supports File Storage Share SAS, File Storage asynchronous copying, exporting Table entities to CSV and specifying manifest name when exporting Table entities
trans-unit.target: Also supports File Storage Share SAS, File Storage asynchronous copying, exporting Table entities to CSV and specifying manifest name when exporting Table entities

trans-unit.source: Current release version.
trans-unit.target: Current release version.

trans-unit.source: Supports Append Blob and FIPS compliant MD5 Setting
trans-unit.target: Supports Append Blob and FIPS compliant MD5 Setting

trans-unit.source: Includes all the functionality from V3.1.0.
trans-unit.target: Includes all the functionality from V3.1.0.

trans-unit.source: Supports synchronously copying blobs and files and specifying content type for destination blobs and files
trans-unit.target: Supports synchronously copying blobs and files and specifying content type for destination blobs and files

trans-unit.source: Supports synchronously copying blobs and specifying content type for destination blobs.
trans-unit.target: Supports synchronously copying blobs and specifying content type for destination blobs.

trans-unit.source: Includes all the functionality from V3.0.0.
trans-unit.target: Includes all the functionality from V3.0.0.

trans-unit.source: Also supports copying files to or from Azure File storage, and copying entities to or from Azure Table storage.
trans-unit.target: Also supports copying files to or from Azure File storage, and copying entities to or from Azure Table storage.

trans-unit.source: Modifies AzCopy command-line syntax to require parameter names, and redesigns the command-line help.
trans-unit.target: Modifies AzCopy command-line syntax to require parameter names, and redesigns the command-line help.

trans-unit.source: This version only supports copying to and from Azure Blob storage.
trans-unit.target: This version only supports copying to and from Azure Blob storage.

trans-unit.source: Optimizes performance when using options /xo and /xn.
trans-unit.target: Optimizes performance when using options /xo and /xn.

trans-unit.source: Fixes bugs related to special characters in source file names and journal file corruption after user input the wrong command-line syntax.
trans-unit.target: Fixes bugs related to special characters in source file names and journal file corruption after user input the wrong command-line syntax.

trans-unit.source: Optimizes performance for large-scale copy scenarios, and introduces several important usability improvements.
trans-unit.target: Optimizes performance for large-scale copy scenarios, and introduces several important usability improvements.

trans-unit.source: Supports specifying the destination folder in the installation wizard.
trans-unit.target: Supports specifying the destination folder in the installation wizard.

trans-unit.source: Supports uploading and downloading files for Azure File storage.
trans-unit.target: Supports uploading and downloading files for Azure File storage.

trans-unit.source: Supports read-access geo-redundant storage accounts.
trans-unit.target: Supports read-access geo-redundant storage accounts.

trans-unit.source: Upgraded to use Azure storage client library version 3.0.3.
trans-unit.target: Upgraded to use Azure storage client library version 3.0.3.

trans-unit.source: Fixed performance issue when copying large amount files within same storage account.
trans-unit.target: Fixed performance issue when copying large amount files within same storage account.

trans-unit.source: Supports setting the virtual directory delimiter for blob names.
trans-unit.target: Supports setting the virtual directory delimiter for blob names.

trans-unit.source: Supports specifying the journal file path.
trans-unit.target: Supports specifying the journal file path.

trans-unit.source: Provides more than 20 options to support blob upload, download, and copy operations in an efficient way.
trans-unit.target: Provides more than 20 options to support blob upload, download, and copy operations in an efficient way.
